newsitem.title: USA: NOTICE OF SALE - LOUISVILLE/JEFFERSON COUNTY, KY..
newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE - LOUISVILLE/JEFFERSON COUNTY, KY..

text.p: Sewer and Drainage System Revenue Refunding Bonds, Series
The Louisville and Jefferson County Metropolitan Sewer District (the District''), hereby gives notice that the District will until the hour of 10:00 A.M., Eastern Time, on
receive in the office of Robert A. Miller, Director of Finance of the District, 700 West Liberty Street,

Louisville, Kentucky 40202, sealed competitive bids for the purchase of $68,100,000* aggregate principal amount of its Sewer and Drainage System Revenue Refunding Bonds, Series 1997B (collectively, the he Bonds are proposed to mature and to be subject to optional and mandatory sinking fund redemption according to the provisions of the Official Terms and Conditions of Bond Sale and the

Preliminary Official Statement available from the Financial Advisor at the address set forth below. Proposals submitted for the purchase of the Bonds are expected to be considered by the Board of the District, at a meeting currently expected to be held on August 21, 1997.

If no bids are received or the District rejects all bids, the District may, in its discretion, take bids on any of the next four (4) succeeding Thursdays at the same time and place, without further notice other than notice provided by Munifacts which notice will be provided on the Wednesday preceding the Thursday at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance of the time for receipt of bids.

Bids must be on Official Bid Form contained in Information for Bidders available from the Financial Advisor, First American Municipals, Inc., telephone (212) 385-9470 (contact Warren O. White) or telecopier (212) 385-9483. Reference should be made to Official Terms and Conditions of Bond Sale and Preliminary Official Statement for details and bidding conditions.
In order to assist bidders in complying with the

requirements of subsection (5) of section (b) of Rule 15c2- 12 promulgated by the Securities and Exchange Commission, the District intends, for the benefit of the holders of the Bonds, to execute a Continuing Disclosure Certificate dated as of the date of original issuance of the Bonds (the Continuing Disclosure Certificate''), setting forth the undertaking of the District to provide certain annual reports and notices of certain events. A description of this undertaking, including certain limitations thereon, is set forth in the Preliminary Official Statement and will also be set forth in the final Official Statement.
*Estimated, subject to change as provided in Official and Conditions of Bond Sale.
